hello I'm Adena a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney
Australia today I'm going to show you
how you can TR shoot G Duty custom
Amazon simple notification service
notifications that are not being
delivered let's get started let's check
the following configurations for the
services involved in this workflow event
delivery confirm the SNS subscription
and the resource based policy attached
to the SNS topic check the permissions
on the AWS Key Management Service
customer master key check the event
Bridge event pattern let's go through
the steps now confirm the SNS
subscription status Amazon SNS sends a
subscription confirmation message to the
Endo that you have subscribed to to make
sure that you confirm the message you
must perform the following actions log
into the AWS Management console and
navigate to the console on the left hand
side of the page choose topics and
select the topic that you have
configured to receive gu alerts for your
Amazon SNS subscription ID verify that
the status is confirmed if the status of
your endpoint is pending confirmation
then go to the endpoint and confirm the
subscription after the SNS subscription
is in the confirm State you must confirm
that the permission on the SNS topic are
configured to allow events. amazon.com
to publish events to it confirming the
SNS access policy go back to the SNS
console on the left hand side of the
page choose topics and select the topic
that you've configured to receive gu
Duty alerts in the details section
scroll down and choose the access policy
tab verify that the access policy allows
the events. Amazon ews.com service
principal to publish events to the SNS
topic the policy must have an allow on
the SNS publish action for the SNS topic
Resource as shown in this example
replace the ARL on the resource with the
appropriate topic AR this is all you
need on the Amazon SNS side of things
permissions on the Amazon Key Management
Service not that if you've enabled
encryption on the SNS topic and you're
using KMS cmks you must make sure that
the KMS cmk used for encryption contains
decrypt permission for the event Bridge
service you can skip this step if you
haven't enabled encryption or if you
using AWS manage keys from the AWS
Management console navigate to the KMS
console
and then choose customer manage keys in
the status field confirm that the key is
in the enabled States in KY ID choose
the AWS KMS key that you have configured
to encrypt SNS messages in the key
policy tab make sure that the policy
contains a statement that allows both
KMS generate data key and KMS decrypt
permission to the events. Amazon aws.com
principal the poish is shown
below finally you must make sure that
the event Bridge pattern correctly
captures the GU Duty findings that you
want to receive allert for confirm event
Bridge pattern navigate to the event
bridge
console choose rules in the event
section and then select the event rule
that you've configured to receive gu UT
aler make sure the status of the rule in
the rule details is enabled and the
event pattern tab verify that the Json
object finding type matches the specific
AWS service similar to the example
provided here you can also select a
detail element after the detail type to
specify the type of gu Duty finding that
you want to receive an allow for the
finding type might also include elements
such as the finding severity thank you
for watching and app cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS
